definitions.definition: To use a buffer or buffers; to isolate or minimize the effects of one thing on another.

subdefinitions.definition: To queue up (an input) so that it is performed immediately once it is possible.
examples: Some games let you buffer jumps—if you hold the jump button mid-air, your character will jump as soon as they touch the ground.

definitions.definition: To store (data) in memory temporarily while it is awaiting processing.
To maintain the acidity of a solution near a chosen value by adding an acid or a base.

main_definition: To use a buffer or buffers; to isolate or minimize the effects of one thing on another.
secondary_definitions: ( transitive or intransitive , computing ) To store (data) in memory temporarily while it is awaiting processing.
( chemistry ) To maintain the acidity of a solution near a chosen value by adding an acid or a base.
